item.title: 2025: the year sustainability didn’t die
item.description: Even with all the challenges of 2025, sustainability managed to sustain in 2025.

item.title: Tom Freston, the beat-poet exec who made MTV cool for 20 years, sees ‘really nothing in it for the consumer’ from Netflix, Warner, or his old company
item.description: The ex-Viacom and Paramount chief is as proud of his new book as he is aghast at MTV leadership. "They've run it into the ground over the last 15 year...

item.title: Is AI really killing finance and banking jobs? Experts say Wall Street’s layoffs may be more hype than takeover—for now
item.description: “I think there’s a little bit of smoke and mirrors there,” said NYU Stern’s Robert Seamans.

item.title: Shield AI took its drones from the ‘Batcave’ to the battlefield. Now the $5.6 billion defense-tech startup’s new CEO says it’s at an inflection point
item.description: After eight months spent tweaking its surveillance drone in Ukraine, demand for Shield AI’s V-BAT is ramping up in Europe and Asia.

item.title: No, you can’t ban all Native Americans if you own a hotel, jury rules. ‘This was never about the money. We sued for one dollar’
item.description: The case was delayed when the company filed for bankruptcy in September 2024. The head of the company, Connie Uhre, passed away this September.
